level.heading: Police officers and fire fighters appointed after the date this chapter becomes effective.

level.text: The following provisions shall not apply to police officers and fire fighters appointed after the date that this chapter becomes effective as provided in § 1-636.02:
Sections 5-521.01, 5-521.02, and 5-521.03 insofar as it affects police officers and firefighters employed by the District of Columbia;
Section 5-1304 insofar as it affects police officers and firefighters employed by the District of Columbia;
Reorganization Order 39, June 18, 1953, as amended (relating to fire trial boards); and
Reorganization Order 48, June 26, 1953, as amended (relating to police trial and review boards).

Notwithstanding subsections (a) or (c) of this section, no provision of law affecting the United States Park Police, United States Secret Service Uniformed Division or Secret Service shall be deemed to be affected.

Notwithstanding the provisions of subsection (a)(1)(B) of this section, or of any other law or regulation, for members of the Metropolitan Police Department, the Assistant and Deputy Chiefs of Police and inspectors shall be selected from among the captains of the force and shall be returned to the rank of captain when the Mayor so determines as provided in § 5-105.01.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 1-608.01 and § 1-636.02.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 15-194, in subsec. (a), substituted "5-105.01(a)," for "5-105.01," in subpar. (B) of par. (1), and substituted "5-402(a)," for "5-402," in subpar. (L) of par. (1).

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90-day) amendment of section, see § 822(b) of the Fiscal Year 2001 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2000 (D.C. Act 13-376, July 24, 2000, 47 DCR 6574).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 2-139
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 2-139, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 1-601.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 7-203
level.text: Law 7-203 was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 7-44, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 29, 1988 and December 13, 1988, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 6, 1989, it was assigned Act No. 7-274 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

level.heading: References in Text
level.text: Section 5-133.07, referenced in (1)(B), was repealed by D.C. Law 9-145, § 302(a), 39 DCR 4895, effective Sept. 10, 1992.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Application of Titles I and VI of D.C. Law 15-194: Section 1301 of D.C. Law 15-194 provided: "Titles I and VI of this act shall apply to pre-1980 employees of the Metropolitan Police Department and the Fire and Emergency Medical Services Department upon their enactment by Congress."
